result.execSummary:
The defendant Tineil N. Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tineil N. Evans is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tineil N. Evans was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Tineil N. Evans was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay supervision fees.    Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.     ** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided). DNA - WAIVED. Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action. Take all prescribed meds.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Hilary Edwards.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  901 -   Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved. DE enters plea of guilty as to Cts 2, 7 - found guilty by the court. All remaining cts dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions - each count concurrent to each other and concurrent to 16CF399. 7 days sentence credit if revoked. Court costs ordered. No restitution requested.  Appeal rights given. DV surcharge and DNA surcharge waived. Any remaining bond on deposit with the court may be used toward fines owed on DE's other cases resolved by plea. (ps 7/19/16)
